results.title: Celebration of life: trees
results.creator_credit: Paul Fillinger and Paul Fillinger Productions
results.brief_description: The beauty and wonder of our natural environment gives cause for a celebration. The viewer joins a group of youngsters discovering and enjoying everything about trees and forests. It is a reminder of the people-nature activities that can be enjoyed. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Caught shoplifting
results.brief_description: Explores and illustrates the economic issues as well as the human motivations behind the act of shoplifting: the desire for adventure; plain boredom; a feeling of alienation or a need to conform. The film does more than direct attention to the scope and social consequences of shoplifting. It focuses on the greatest need to examine our individual understanding of ethics and morality, and to avoid the near occasions of self-indulgence in theft.

results.title: Catchwords: ideas for spelling
results.creator_credit: O. Hollander and Educational Technology Unit, Toorak State College
results.brief_description: Charles Cripps, author of the spelling manual “Catchwords” is interviewed by Sue Brockfield and Howard Mould. Cripps outlines several strategies useful for the teaching of spelling. He strongly advocates the “look, cover, write and check” system which is explained during the interview.
results.creator_credit_for_label: O. Hollander and Educational Technology Unit, Toorak State College

results.creator_credit: Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture. Longerenong Campus

results.title: Catching stripies: tuna fishing
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Fisheries and Wildlife
results.brief_description: Shows experimental trials using new equipment and fishing techniques for catching striped tuna near Lakes Entrance in Victoria. Alos shows aspects of the work carried out on the fishing boat.

results.title: Catching stars of baseball
results.brief_description: An instructional film by four of America’s leading catchers in the major baseball leagues. Aimed at junoir baseballers where very few want to take a catcher’s job. Covers areas such as equipment required, stance, signals, throwing, catching, tactics and tagging.

results.title: Casual menace
results.brief_description: Sleeping rough in bus shelters and roadside ditches from Darwin to Dubbo, the artists collect a large image-gallery of characters, landscapes, abstractions and moods. Using video and Super 8, they explore the alienating environments of the road and the lonesome souls who travel through these spaces and times. A dark meditation on the nomadic spaces of rural Australia, Casual Menace is composed of two interrelated video loops The Chance Map and Moths. Using the footage gathered from their numerous hitchhiking ‘experiments’, the artists explore the fragile, lonely spaces of remote highways.

results.title: Castles and country: a view of Scotland
results.creator_credit: Shirley Cobham, National Benzole and Random Films
results.brief_description: Illustrates the work of the National Trust for Scotland in preserving castles, palaces, historical sites such as Glencoe, Iona, and the gardens of Crarae, Ardkinglass and Inverewe. Each sequence beings with a close-up, then opens out to a general view enabling appreciation of the architectural line or scene.

results.title: Carrot nose
results.brief_description: Animated puppets are used to tell a story about some children who visit their grandmother at the farm where they build a snow man whose carrot nose is stolen by rabbits who need food in the wintertime.
